Class Student

  • java.lang.Object
    • Person
      • Student

  • public class Student
extends Person
    This class represents a Student, who will be part of a Course, and will have an amount of time studied and amount of time not studied. A Student is-a Person.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Student(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String username)
      Creates a Student, assigning values to Student's private values.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getNonStudyHours()
      Returns the Student's number of hours not spent studying.
      int getStudyHours()
      Returns the Student's number of study hours.
      double getStudyPercentage()
      Returns the Student's percentage of time spent sudying as a double, making sure not to divide by zero.
      void relax(int hours)
      Increases the value of nonStudyHours by a specific number of hours, as long as hours is not less than 0.
      void study(int hours)
      Increases the value of studyHours by a specific number of hours, as long as hours is not less than 0.

      • Methods inherited from class Person

        getFirstName, getLastName, getUsername

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Student

        public Student(java.lang.String firstName,
               java.lang.String lastName,
               java.lang.String username)
        Creates a Student, assigning values to Student's private values. All Students start with 0 study hours and 0 non-study hours.
        Parameters:
        firstName - The first name of this Student.
        lastName - The last name of this Student.
        username - The Student's username for logging in to "T-Square".

    • Method Detail

      • getStudyHours

        public int getStudyHours()
        Returns the Student's number of study hours.
        Returns:
        The Student's number of study hours.

      • getNonStudyHours

        public int getNonStudyHours()
        Returns the Student's number of hours not spent studying.
        Returns:
        The Student's number of hours not spent studying.

      • getStudyPercentage

        public double getStudyPercentage()
        Returns the Student's percentage of time spent sudying as a double, making sure not to divide by zero.
        Returns:
        The Student's percentage of time spent studying.

      • study

        public void study(int hours)
        Increases the value of studyHours by a specific number of hours, as long as hours is not less than 0.
        Parameters:
        hours - The number of hours spent studying.

      • relax

        public void relax(int hours)
        Increases the value of nonStudyHours by a specific number of hours, as long as hours is not less than 0.
        Parameters:
        hours - The number of hours spent relaxing.
